jobs.title: Data Visualisation Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

We are looking for a Data Visualisation Engineer to build the next generation of scientist-centred AI tools for accelerating scientific discovery, our understanding of the universe, and solving climate change.

You’ll work closely with our computational and experimental groups to build agentic LLM tools which democratise the usage of Orbital Materials’ SOTA simulation models and work at the fore-front of AI-accelerated scientific research.

This role will be focused on delivering software which integrates frontier AI research into the workflow of scientists. This will involve designing and implementing front-end tools for novel interaction patterns with generative models, LLMs, and scientific visualizations. This role will be foundational in establishing our UI best practices, ensuring we have consistent and exceptional UX across our tools.

You will be working alongside the scientists who use these tools for every aspect of the materials discovery and technology development pipeline, and uniquely placed to guide the development of a new, AI-powered methodology for rapidly scaling crucial technologies for the energy transition.

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement responsive, intuitive user interfaces for our web-based applications

  • Build robust and performant user interfaces for data-heavy applications

  • Translate user requirements into intuitive user experiences

Develop the standards and systems for our front-end design and development

  • Design and build out our component library and front-end tooling

  • Help build our first design system to unify our look and feel across applications

Develop novel front-end interfaces which allow scientists to perform AI-accelerated research

  • Push the boundaries of human-computer interaction for chemistry and chemical engineering applications

  • Help design and build data visualizations for scientific and engineering data

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a frontend engineer

  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS

  • Experience with modern frontend frameworks (React, Vue, or Svelte)

  • Familiarity with data visualization libraries (D3.js, Plotly, Three.js, etc.)

  • Experience in data-heavy scientific or engineering domains is a bonus

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary commensurate with AI sector

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plan

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites to the USA and beyond

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organization dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

Orbital Materials is seeking a highly skilled and innovative Senior Mechanical Engineer to design and optimize advanced modular data centers, focusing on revolutionary two-phase direct-to-chip cooling applications leveraging Orbital's proprietary fluid discoveries, and developing dual-use chiller systems for simultaneous data center cooling and carbon capture.

This role involves hands-on participation in cutting-edge research, including design and layout of mechanical systems for data center equipment and actively participating in and conducting lab experiments to verify the validity and performance of our modular data centers, novel cooling solutions and integrated carbon capture systems.

Key Responsibilities

Mechanical Systems Design for Modular Data Centers and Cooling Solutions

  • Selection of coils, heat exchangers, chillers, compressors,

  • Working with key stakeholders to optimize designs for performance, manufacturability, and ease of deployment

Design and Thermodynamic Analysis for Cold Plate Cooling Systems

  • Assist in setup, running and analysis of results for CFD

  • Assist in setup, running and analysis of results for FEA

Design, Selection and Analysis of Refrigeration Systems

  • Compare the impact on overall efficiency of the data center of different refrigerants for the ambient design condition

  • Select compressors, expansion valves, and other supporting systems

Coordination, Review and Approval of Technical Reports and Documentation

  • Review internal engineering work as well as external contractors such as CFD and FEA analysis

What We’re Looking For

  • Professional engineering designation in Alberta, Canada or local regulatory body

  • Experience in the design and equipment selection of mechanical systems used for data center cooling and/or HVAC systems

  • Familiarity with various data center tiers and best practices for efficiency and reliability

  • Continuous improvement mindset

  • Experience in the design, selection, and optimization of chiller systems for large-scale cooling applications

  • Proficiency in conducting thermodynamic analysis to optimize cooling system performance, energy efficiency, and heat transfer.

  • Experience with relevant simulation software (e.g., CFD, FEA) for thermal and fluid dynamics an asset

  • Practical experience in designing and executing lab experiments to validate the performance of mechanical systems, cooling solutions, and integrated systems.

  • Ability to interpret experimental data and translate findings into design improvements.

  • Experience in the selection and design of refrigeration systems and components

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary commensurate with AI sector

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Pension with company match

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plans

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organization dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Chief Financial Officer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

In this role, you’ll take the lead in structuring and securing financing to power Orbital’s capital-intensive supply chains, ensuring the business is positioned for significant growth over the coming years.

The CFO will design and drive the annual budget, long-range financial plans, and forecasting processes, translating strategy into clear financial roadmaps. We require somebody who understands deep-tech, surfacing trends, risks, and opportunities that shape the direction of Orbital, whilst being at the forefront of decisions to deliver sharp, impactful insights to senior leadership and the Board.

Key Responsibilities

  • Structure and secure the financing for complex Orbital’s capital-intensive supply chains

  • Develop and oversee the annual budget, long-range financial plans, and forecasting processes, aligning financial strategy with Orbital’s ambitious growth objectives.

  • Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), analyze financial results, and provide insightful reporting and analysis to senior leadership, highlighting trends, risks, and opportunities.

  • Prepare and present clear, concise financial reports and presentations to the executive team and the Board of Directors.

  • Own and manage the full-cycle accounting function (inc. annual tax returns, audits, etc).

What We’re Looking For

  • Extensive experience in capital strategy, fundraising, and financial leadership—ideally in start-up, scale-up, manufacturing or deeptech

  • Are hands-on, adaptable, and thrive in ambiguity—you're excited to build systems and finance processes

  • Deep understanding of financial planning, forecasting, budgeting, and financial modeling techniques.

  • Have successfully raised equity and non-dilutive capital from a range of sources

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary commensurate with AI sector

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plan

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites to the USA and beyond

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organization dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Researcher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

As a Machine Learning Researcher at Orbital, you'll work on world-class foundation models for atomistic systems, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven materials discovery. You'll design and implement cutting-edge ML architectures whilst collaborating closely with experimental scientists to translate foundational research into breakthrough real-world applications. This role offers the opportunity to pursue ambitious, high-quality research that directly accelerates our mission to solve major global technology challenges through AI-discovered advanced materials and beyond.

Key Responsibilities

Independently design, implement and benchmark high-performance ML models

  • Develop novel deep learning architectures for complex scientific domains, with work that meets publication standards at top-tier conferences

  • Demonstrate strong implementation skills through hands-on development in PyTorch and related frameworks

  • Drive research projects from conception through to deployment, showing initiative and technical depth

Coordinate with cross-functional teams, rapidly acquiring relevant domain knowledge

  • Collaborate effectively with computational and experimental scientists, translating domain requirements into ML solutions

  • Demonstrate intellectual curiosity and the ability to quickly master new scientific domains outside your immediate expertise

  • Bridge the gap between foundational ML research and practical applications in materials science

Prototype and iterate rapidly whilst maintaining rigorous engineering standards

  • Build robust, well-engineered codebases that others can build upon, balancing research velocity with code quality

  • Engage continuously with the latest ML literature, staying current with developments in foundation models, generative AI and scientific machine learning

  • Contribute to establishing technical best practices and knowledge sharing within the research team

What We're Looking For

  • PhD or 3-5 years of experience in machine learning research

  • A strong ability to reason about algorithms, data structures, linear algebra and probabilistic concepts

  • A strong ability to debug complex machine learning systems through meticulous attention to detail, testing of edge cases and carefully selected ablations

  • An appreciation for high-quality code and software engineering practices

  • A genuine interest in pursuing AI-driven scientific discovery and building computational tools that enable breakthrough materials research

  • Upon reading Hamming's You and Your Research, you're inspired by quotes such as:

    • "Yes, I would like to do first-class work"

    • "Great scientists … will go forward under incredible circumstances; they think and continue to think"

    • "The more you know, the more you learn; the more you learn, the more you can do; the more you can do, the more the opportunity - it is very much like compound interest"

    • "You should do your job in such a fashion that others can build on top of it, so they will indeed say, 'Yes, I've stood on so and so's shoulders and I saw further.' The essence of science is cumulative. By changing a problem slightly you can often do great work rather than merely good work. Instead of attacking isolated problems, I made the resolution that I would never again solve an isolated problem except as characteristic of a class"

Bonus: Experience working with graph neural networks, message passing neural networks, or computational methods on graphs, 3D point clouds, or other 3D data. Experience training, evaluating or building with large language models.

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary commensurate with AI sector

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plan

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites to the USA and beyond

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organisation dedicated to a better future

  • Clear pathways to technical leadership and ownership of research domains as we scale

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: AI Technical Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

We are seeking a Technical Lead to tackle some of the most diverse and consequential challenges at the intersection of AI and hardware/industrial development—from atomic to data-centre-scale. This role requires setting the technical bar high, rapidly up skilling across unfamiliar domains by collaborating with domain experts, and building production AI systems while managing a small world class team.



Key Responsibilities

1. Set the Technical Bar & Ensure Engineering Excellence

  • Hands on coding - including establishing and maintaining exceptionally high standards for code quality, system architecture, and ML engineering practices

  • Conduct rigorous code reviews that elevate team capabilities

  • Build robust, maintainable systems that serve as foundations for others to build upon

  • Create a culture of technical rigour, first-principles thinking, and engineering craftsmanship

2. Lead & Deliver High-Impact AI Projects Across Diverse Domains

  • Own end-to-end delivery of AI systems: from data pipelines and model training to production deployment

  • Develop and deploy solutions across the entire technology development pipeline—some examples include computational chemistry simulations, materials optimisation, supply chain management agents, and more

  • Rapidly up skill in new technical areas through close collaboration with domain experts (no prior chemistry or materials experience required)

  • Balance research rigour with pragmatic engineering to deliver production-ready systems

3. Line Manage, Mentor & Development

  • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and career development for our AI engineers

  • Manage the intake and development of AI residency programme participants

  • Foster a culture of learning, curiosity, and first-principles problem solving

  • Manage a high-performing team that can independently tackle complex, novel problems

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of professional, with at least 1 years in a leadership role experience as a machine learning engineer, research engineer, or software engineer.

  • Professional track record of successfully applying AI and machine learning across multiple domains, demonstrating the ability to rapidly up skill and deliver results in unfamiliar problem spaces

  • Proven experience training, evaluating, and productionising AI models at scale, with a deep understanding of the full ML lifecycle from research to deployment

  • Strong engineering fundamentals with the ability to write high-quality, maintainable code and architect robust systems that others can build upon

  • Experience managing, mentoring, or leading technical teams, with a commitment to developing others' skills and careers

  • Excitement about working at the intersection of AI and physical sciences, where models must interface with real-world constraints and experimental validation

Nice to see

  • Experience with physics-informed or chemistry-focused AI applications. Experience building or fine-tuning large language models. Background in computational chemistry, materials science, or related scientific domains.

  • Experience with agent-based systems, tool use, or agentic workflows. Contributions to open-source ML projects or published research.

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary commensurate with AI sector

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plan

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites to the USA and beyond

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organisation dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Supply Chain Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

In this role, you will be building your ideal team of professionals and establishing the supply and inventory systems for a new suite of data center related products including a 2 Phase Direct to Chip cooling system utilizing a new novel coolant discovered by Orbitals AI technology, Coolant Distribution Units, Dual Purpose Chiller and Modular Data Centers.

Initially, this role will start with outsourcing production to contract manufacturing requiring the establishment of new processes and procedures for validating and onboarding suppliers.

In our 2nd phase, we will be establishing our in-house manufacturing capabilities requiring building of teams and processes from the ground up.

Key Responsibilities

Take an active and lead role in the building of a new and resilient supply chain team of professionals responsible for managing all aspects of supply and inventory management for our data center products:

Phase 1 — Contract Builder Evaluation & Stand-Up

  • Source and pre-qualify Contract Manufacturers (CMs) and key suppliers; run RFI/RFP/RFQ processes with clear requirements, forecasts, and acceptance criteria.

  • Perform commercial and technical due diligence: capacity, process capability, quality systems (ISO 9001/14001), financial stability, ESG posture, etc.

  • Lead cost breakdown analyses (labor, materials, overhead, NRE, tooling), total landed cost modeling, and should-cost benchmarks.

  • Establish an onboarding playbook with contract manufacturers: part numbering, revision control, change communication, incoming inspection plans, and packaging/labeling standards.

  • Build supplier scorecards and QBR cadence; set up tier-2/3 visibility for critical components and risk continuity plans.

  • Establish and maintain vendor schedules coordinating between sub-component vendors, contract manufacturers and end customers

Phase 2 — In-House Manufacturing Launch

  • Stand up procurement, receiving, and inventory management functions from zero: policies, SOPs, work instructions, and controls (cycle counts, adjustments, segregation of NCRs).

  • Select and implement ERP/MRP (or extend current): item master, BOMs/routings, suppliers, price lists, lead times, safety stocks, reorder points, and approvals.

  • Design warehouse layout and material flow: stocking strategies (ABC/XYZ), bin locations, barcoding/labeling, kitting, Kanban/supermarket, and point-of-use delivery.

  • Create receiving & inspection processes (AQL plans, COA/COC handling), MRB/NCR/CAPA workflows, and supplier corrective action loops.

  • Build the approved vendor list (AVL) and dual-source critical parts; manage tooling/NRE, qualification runs, and ramp readiness with Ops/Quality/Engineering.

Ongoing Procurement & Inventory Control

  • Own demand/supply planning and S&OP: forecast consumption, capacity checks with CMs/Plant, and constrained plans.

  • Place and manage purchase orders; expedite/de-expedite to service build plans while minimizing excess/obsolete (E&O).

  • Optimize inventory (DOH, turns, service level) via safety-stock modeling, MOQ/EOQ, and lead-time reduction.

  • Drive cost-down programs (VA/VE, alternates, design-for-supply, panelization/2D nesting/1D nesting where relevant) and renegotiations.

  • Manage inbound logistics and trade compliance: HTS codes, country of origin, documentation, brokers, customs, and duties optimization.

  • Maintain accurate data: prices, lead times, supplier performance, and part attributes; enforce revision control across Engineering/Production.

  • Monitor and improve performance via scorecards (OTD, PPM, responsiveness, cost, sustainability).

Risk, Compliance & Sustainability

  • Map the multi-tier supply chain; identify single-points-of-failure and create continuity plans (buffers, alternates, dual tooling).

  • Ensure compliance with safety, environmental, and ethical sourcing standards; maintain documentation for audits.

Systems, Analytics & Reporting

  • Own ERP/MRP configurations, approval workflows, and segregation of duties.

  • Build dashboards and KPIs; automate routine reporting and alerts (e.g., late POs, inventory accuracy, stockouts risk).

  • Implement barcoding/RFID and digital receiving/issuance for real-time traceability.

Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Partner with Engineering on DFM/DFA and early supplier involvement; influence specs for cost/lead-time/quality.

  • Align with Finance on standard costs, PPV, accruals, and cash-flow terms; with Legal on contracts/IP.

What We’re Looking For

  • Start-up Mindset: ability to work within the “gray” as a valuable team member to refine, clarify, and continuously improve and automate processes and designs.

  • Procurement & Negotiation: Strategic sourcing, cost modeling/should-cost, contracts/MSAs, Incoterms, hedging/indexation.

  • Planning & Inventory: S&OP, MRP, safety stock/EOQ modeling, ABC/XYZ, cycle counting, kitting/kanban.

  • Quality & Compliance: PPAP/FAI, inspection planning (AQL), NCR/MRB/CAPA, supplier audits, ISO 9001; familiarity with ISO 14001/EHS and trade compliance.

  • Systems: ERP/MRP (e.g., SAP/Oracle/NetSuite/Microsoft Dynamics), barcoding/RFID, advanced Excel and data tools (Power BI/Tableau).

  • Manufacturing & DFM: Understanding of BOMs/routings, tolerances, alternates, and design-for-supply; experience onboarding CMs.

  • Logistics: Freight modes, brokers, customs, HTS/CoO, duty optimization; VMI/consignment.

  • Risk Management: Multi-tier mapping, dual-sourcing, continuity planning, scenario modeling.

  • Soft Skills: Supplier relationship management, cross-functional leadership, clear documentation, change management, and coaching/people development.

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary and pension with company match

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plans

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organization dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

jobs.title: Quality Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Orbital’s hardware solutions solve the biggest challenges in data centers. Each of our products contains an advanced material discovered with our AI, giving it breakthrough real-world performance. We’re looking for ambitious thinkers and builders; those excited by the challenge of bridging AI and industry, chemistry and computation, discovery and deployment.

Our mission is to usher in an era where new, advanced materials are both discovered and engineered with AI and we’ll use this to build hardware that solve major global technology challenges.

Joining Orbital Materials means working at the intersection of deep tech, applied science, and engineering innovation. We are a truly global organisation with sites in London (UK) San Francisco (CA), Princeton (NJ) & Calgary (Canada) building teams in ML Research and Product Development to Mechanical and Chemical Engineering, offering opportunities for talented individuals who want to shape the future of materials and their applications in high-impact industries.

Role Overview

In this role, you will be building your ideal team of professionals and establishing the quality department for a new suite of data center related products including a 2 Phase Direct to Chip cooling system utilizing a new novel coolant discovered by Orbitals AI technology, Coolant Distribution Units, Dual Use Chiller and Modular Data Centers.

Initially, this role will start with outsourcing production to contract manufacturing requiring the establishment of new processes and procedures for validating and onboarding suppliers.

In our 2nd phase, we will be establishing our in-house manufacturing capabilities requiring building of teams and processes from the ground up.

You will own product and process quality from concept through field life. Build a scalable QMS, prevent defects at the source, and ensure every unit (and module) ships safe, compliant, and reliable.

Key Responsibilities

Phase 1 — Contract Manufacturer Validation, Onboarding & Quality Management

  • Source & qualify CMs and key suppliers: conduct technical/commercial audits (capacity, process capability, ISO 9001/14001, special processes related to quality, EHS)

  • APQP at CMs: define CTQs/CTPs, control plans, PFMEA/DFMEA alignment, MSA, submission/approval of vendors; oversee FOK pilot builds.

  • Quality agreements & documentation: establish supplier quality agreements, traceability schema (serial/lot genealogy), inspection/test instructions, packaging/labeling/handling standards.

  • Performance management: implement supplier scorecards (OTD, PPM, responsiveness, audit scores); run QBRs; drive SCAR/CAPA with effectiveness verification and aging control.

  • Field & commissioning interface for CM builds: define FAT/SAT witness criteria, release gates, and containment plans; triage escapes with 8D/A3 and feed lessons into CM control plans.

Phase 2 — Establish the In-House Quality Organization (New Manufacturing Plant)

  • Build the QMS: implement ISO 9001 backbone (coordinate with 14001/45001 where relevant); write SOPs/WIs, MRB/CAPA governance, document control, and e-sign workflows.

  • Factory quality architecture: stand up in-process, and final test (FAT) for CDUs and modular skids; define station-level CTQs, stop-the-line criteria, etc.

  • People & org: hire, train, and coach inspectors, technicians, SQEs/CQEs; set tiered daily management (tier boards, paretos, andons) and a prevention-first culture (poka-yoke, error-proof fixtures).

  • Systems integration: integrate Quality with PLM/ERP/MES for single source of truth; enable digital travelers, barcoding/RFID traceability, and automated data capture from test stands.

  • Ramp & readiness: plan EVT/DVT/PVT at the plant; qualify production lines/process windows; lock control plans and release criteria before rate increase.

  • Compliance & certifications: secure/maintain with the required multi-departmental team members UL/CSA/CE/UKCA, EMC/LVD, UL 508A for panels, pressure equipment (ASME/PED, CRN), refrigerant handling safety, RoHS/REACH documentation.

Ongoing, Cross-Phase Responsibilities

  • Reliability & field quality: track MTBF/FFR, drive failure analysis (5-Whys, fishbone, FTA), manage warranty/RMA and design/process feedback loops.

  • Continuous improvement & COPQ reduction: DOE, SPC, yield improvement, and cost-of-quality tracking; implement mistake-proofing and automation.

  • Risk management: multi-tier mapping, single-point-of-failure mitigation, dual sourcing/tooling, business continuity playbooks.

  • Data & reporting: dashboards for FPY, DPPM, escapes, NCR/CAPA aging, Cp/Cpk; automated alerts for trends and thresholds.

  • Commissioning & site quality (modular DCs): align FAT/SAT with L1–L5 commissioning; define install standards (purge/evac/charge, wiring, firmware); train service partners.

What We’re Looking For

  • Start-up Mindset: ability to work within the “gray” as a valuable team member to refine, clarify, and continuously improve and automate processes and designs.

  • 8–12+ years in complex electro-mechanical/thermal hardware quality; cooling/pressure systems (CDUs, cold plates, manifolds) or similar manufacturing.

  • Experience or familiarity with using AI to improve and automate processes

  • Mastery of APQP, DFMEA/PFMEA, Control Plans, MSA (GR&R), SPC, 8D/A3, DOE.

  • Supplier quality leadership (audits, special-process approval, global containment).

  • QMS ownership (ISO 9001) and audit management; rigorous configuration/document control.

  • Data fluency (Minitab or equivalent, advanced Excel; BI tools).

  • Strong communication, shop-floor presence, and change leadership.

Why Join Orbital?

  • Competitive salary and pension with company match

  • Flexible and generous paid time off

  • Excellent health, dental and vision insurance plans

  • Equity package - the ability to own part of Orbital Materials as we grow

  • Regular company offsites

  • The experience of working in a cutting-edge organization dedicated to a better future

Orbital Materials is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
